news.title: HP Unveils Power-Packed Pavilion Laptops for GenZ and Millennials in India

articles.title: HP Unveils Power-Packed Pavilion Laptops for GenZ and Millennials in India
articles.summary: HP Unveils Power-Packed Pavilion Laptops for GenZ and Millennials in IndiaGet ready to level up your digital lifestyle with HP's latest Pavilion Plus laptops, designed to cater to the diverse needs of GenZ and millennials in India. Packed with 13th Gen Intel® Core™ processors, the new HP Pavilion Plus series promises to keep up with your fast-paced life and computing demands.Introducing the Sleek HP Pavilion Plus 14 and the Affordable HP 14 & 15As the work-from-home culture continues to thrive, young consumers are seeking devices that offer seamless connectivity and entertainment on the go. The HP Pavilion Plus 14 is built to meet this demand with its x360 hinge, multi-touch capability, and an array of ports to integrate your tech ecosystem effortlessly.Weighing a mere 1.39 kgs, the Pavilion Plus 14 sports a clean and modern design, available in Natural Silver, Rose Gold, Warm Gold, and Spruce Blue. The 14-inch laptop also features a manual camera shutter door for enhanced privacy and security.Vickram Bedi, Senior Director - Personal Systems, HP India , shares, At HP, we constantly expand and innovate our ecosystem to meet the evolving needs of our young and modern consumers. We have built the all-new HP Pavilion Plus 14 laptops, to cater to the hybrid lifestyle with features such as multi-touch and numerous ports. Additionally, our new HP 14 and HP 15 are built to provide superior performance at an affordable price, so users remain connected, engaged, and productive.Uncompromising Performance Meets AffordabilityHP has also launched its all-new HP 14 and HP 15 laptops, focusing on versatility and affordability. Compact and easy to carry, these laptops boast a seamless metal design on the cover chassis, the latest Intel processors for robust performance and multitasking, and an optional fingerprint reader for faster, secure log-ins.Sustainable Tech for the WinAligning with HP's commitment to sustainability, all newly launched devices, including the HP Pavilion Plus, HP Pavilion X360 , HP 14, and 15, are built with ocean-bound plastic and post-consumer recycled plastic.Pricing and AvailabilityThe HP 14 starts at INR 39,999, the HP Pavilion X360 at INR 57,999, and the HP Pavilion Plus 14 at INR 81,999.Don't miss out on the chance to experience the perfect blend of style, performance, and sustainability with HP's latest Pavilion laptops in India!

articles.title: Pavilion Plus: HP launches new Pavilion Plus series laptops in India: Price, specs and more
articles.summary: HP new laptops: Price and availabilityHP Pavilion Plus series: Key specs and featuresOther features include:EyeSafe-certified OLED display that supports 400 nits brightnessMulti-touch functionality for improved mobile productivity13th Gen Intel Core processors and DDR5 RAMCore processors and DDR5 RAM HP True Vision 5MP camera with Temporal Noise Reduction and AI noise reductionManual camera shutter for privacyMultiple port options for multitaskingHP 14 and HP 15: Key specs and featuresOther features include:HP 14 weighs 1.4kg and HP 15 weighs 1.6 kgManual shutter door for privacyEquipped with Wi-Fi 6 for faster connectivityFeatures Full HD camera with Temporal Noise Reduction and AI Noise Removal for better video and sound qualityHP organised an event to introduce its latest Pavilion Plus series of laptops in India. The lineup includes two new laptops -- the HP Pavilion X360 and the HP Pavilion Plus 14 . These new notebooks come powered by 13th Gen Intel Core processors. The company claims that these new laptops will “keep up with these consumers’ fast-paced lifestyle and their diverse computing needs.”Apart from this, the laptop maker has also launched its HP 14 and HP 15 models. The company claims that these models will offer improved performance, design and security features. HP also noted that these new laptop models are the company’s most popular and highest-selling consumer notebooks in India.In line with HP’s sustainability commitment, the newly launched laptops are built with ocean-bound plastic and post-consumer recycled plastic.The HP 14 laptop will be available at a starting price of Rs 39,999. Whereas, the HP Pavilion X360 starts at Rs 57,999. Meanwhile, the HP Pavilion Plus 14 carries a price tag of Rs 81,999. The company didn’t mention the starting price of the HP 15 laptops. These new laptop models will be available across both online and offline retail channels. The Pavilion range of laptops is available in three colour options which include -- Natural Silver, Rose Gold, Warm Gold and Spruce Blue.The HP Pavilion Plus 14 comes with an x360 hinge and multi-touch functionality. It also comes with multiple port options such as f USB-C ports, a USB-C power adapter, HDMI and a headphone jack.The HP Pavilion x360 14-inch laptop is equipped with a manual camera shutter door to provide enhanced privacy and security. Meanwhile, the Pavilion Plus 14 laptop weighs just 1.39 kgs.These compact laptops promise to deliver improved portability. These laptops have a metal design on the cover chassis. With Intel’s latest processors, the laptops claim to deliver enhanced performance and multitasking. The optional fingerprint reader also provides a faster and more secure way to log in.

articles.title: HP India prepares for hybrid workplaces with new Pavilion PC portfolio
articles.summary: Follow us on Image Source : HP HP Pavilion PC portfolioAs India's growing economy presents a significant opportunity for the expansion of PC usage particularly in smaller towns and rural areas, PC and printer major HP Inc on Tuesday launched a new PC portfolio to meet the evolving demands of consumers in the country.HP has introduced its latest Pavilion Plus notebooks in India. articles.title: HP 2023 laptop line-up launched in India: All you need to know about Pavilion Plus 14, Pavilion X360, HP 14, HP 15
articles.summary: HP launched its latest range of laptops in India which the company claims is aimed at GenZ and millennial buyers. news.title: Vivo X90 series to be sold via Flipkart post India launch

articles.title: Vivo X90 series Flipkart availability confirmed ahead of India launch
articles.summary: The Vivo X90 series’ launch date in India is April 26th, and Flipkart has now confirmed the availability of the new smartphones on its platform. Other than Flipkart, the Vivo X90 series is expected to also sell through the company’s online store.The flagship Vivo X90 series, which has already debuted in China and in some markets internationally, features three phones in total — Vivo X90, Vivo X90 Pro, and Vivo X90 Pro+. The company, however, hasn’t confirmed if all three models are arriving in India as well. The Flipkart teaser also doesn’t shed any light on this information. There are speculations though that only the Vivo X90 and Vivo X90 Pro will launch in India since the Vivo X90 Pro+ is available only in China. For those interested, the Vivo X90 series India launch is scheduled to take place at 12 noon on April 26.Vivo X90, Vivo X90 Pro specificationsThe Vivo X90 and Vivo X90 Pro feature a 6.78-inch AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate and a 300Hz touch sampling rate. The Pro variant has a better 2K resolution. Both phones are also powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 9200 chipset paired with Immortalis-G715 GPU for graphics. You can get up to 12GB of RAM and 512GB of onboard storage with UFS 4.0.There are some differences in the camera department of the two phones. The Vivo X90 has a triple rear camera setup with a 50MP primary sensor, a 12MP portrait lens and a 12MP ultrawide sensor. For selfies, there’s a 32MP front camera. The Vivo X90 Pro also has a 50MP primary sensor but with a 50MP portrait sensor and a 12MP ultrawide sensor. It also houses a 32MP front camera for selfies.The Vivo X90 Pro packs a larger 4,870mAh battery than the 4,810mAh battery on the X90 but bot phones come with 120W fast charging support. More features on the Vivo X90 series include 5G support, dual-band Wi-Fi 6, stereo speakers, Hi-Res audio and an in-display fingerprint sensor.

articles.title: Vivo to launch its X90 series in India this month; Check debut date, key specs and all you need to know
articles.summary: Be the first to experience the Xtreme.Mark your calendars as the #vivoX90Series launches on 26th April 2023 at 12 PM.​​Stay tuned for more!​Know more: https:t.coW8bj8Lfpit​#XtremeImagination #ComingSoon pic.twitter.comUf7mUKq7E8 — vivo India (@Vivo_India) April 17, 2023FAQs:The Vivo X90 series has been introduced in various markets worldwide, but its launch in India is still pending. However, the company has now announced that it will debut the X90 series in India on April 26 at 12 pm IST . Although the X90 Pro+ is not likely to be included, we can expect the launch of the other two members of the series - the X90 Pro and the standard X90 - similar to what was introduced in Europe.With a 120Hz refresh rate, the 6.78-inch AMOLED display of the Vivo X90 guarantees smooth scrolling and seamless video playback. Its front-facing camera is placed in a punch-hole cutout, and the display supports HDR10+ technology, enhancing the colours and contrasts for an immersive visual experience.The X90 Pro features a 2K resolution and a 20:9 aspect ratio, providing an even more enhanced display compared to the X90. Additionally, it boasts a 452 PPI, 2160Hz PWM , HDR10+, and 300Hz touch sampling rate, delivering a more vivid and detailed visual experience.Both the X90 and X90 Pro are equipped with the MediaTek Dimensity 9200 chipset along with Immortalis-G715, ensuring quick and efficient performance. They come with up to 12GB LPDDR5 RAM and 512GB UFS 4.0 storage, providing ample storage space for all your applications and files.The Vivo X90 comes with a rear camera setup consisting of three lenses, including a 50MP IMX866 primary sensor with f1.75 aperture, OIS, EIS, and LED flash, a 12MP portrait sensor with f2.0 aperture and 2x optical zoom, and a 12MP ultrawide sensor with f2.0 aperture. The front of the phone is equipped with a 32MP camera with f2.45 aperture for taking selfies and making video calls.Meanwhile, the X90 Pro has a 50MP portrait sensor with f1.6 aperture and 2x optical zoom, in addition to the 50MP IMX866 primary sensor with f1.75 aperture, OIS, EIS, and LED flash, and the 12MP ultrawide sensor with f2.0 aperture. The front-facing camera remains the same with a 32MP sensor and f2.45 aperture for selfies and video calls.According to reports, both the X90 and X90 Pro have extended battery life and fast charging capabilities. The X90 has a 4,810mAh battery, while the X90 Pro has a slightly larger 4,870mAh battery. Both devices support 120W wired fast charging. They also offer 5G and 4G LTE connectivity, dual-band Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth 5.2, GPS, and a USB Type-C port for charging and data transfer. Additionally, they are equipped with an in-display fingerprint sensor for security purposes, stereo speakers, aptX HD, and Hi-Res audio features.On April 26 at 12 pm ISTBoth the X90 and X90 Pro are equipped with the MediaTek Dimensity 9200 chipset along with Immortalis-G715, ensuring quick and efficient performance.

articles.title: Vivo X90 series launch date, price in India
articles.summary: Vivo X90 series launch date, price in IndiaThe 6.78-inch AMOLED display on the Vivo X90 sports a refresh rate of 120 Hz, a punch-hole cutout, HDR10+, a touch sampling rate of 300 Hz, and a resolution of 2,800 x 1,260 pixels.By Telangana Today Published Date - 01:30 PM, Tue - 18 April 23Hyderabad: Vivo has finally announced the launch of the Vivo X90 Pro in India this month. The reports say that the Vivo X90 Pro will be released in India on April 26 at 12 p.m. The price details of the Vivo X90 Pro are yet to be released.The 6.78-inch AMOLED display on the Vivo X90 sports a refresh rate of 120 Hz, a punch-hole cutout, HDR10+, a touch sampling rate of 300 Hz, and a resolution of 2,800 x 1,260 pixels.While the 6.78-inch AMOLED display on the Vivo X90 Pro offers a 2K resolution. Punch-hole cutout, a 20:9 aspect ratio, 452 PPI, 2160Hz PWM, HDR10+, 300Hz touch sampling rate, and a refresh rate of 120Hz are all included. The resolution is 2,800 by 1,260 pixels.The MediaTek Dimensity 9200 chipset paired with the Immartalis-G715 processor powers the Vivo X90 and Vivo X90 Pro. The Vivo X90 series has 512GB of UFS 4.0 storage and up to 12GB of LPDDR5 RAM.The Vivo X90 has three cameras on the back: a 12MP portrait sensor with an f2.0 aperture and a 2x optical zoom; a 50MP IMX866 main sensor with an f1.75 aperture, OIS, EIS, and LED flash; and a 12MP ultrawide sensor with an f2.0 aperture. For selfies and video calls, there is a 32MP camera with an f2.45 aperture on the front.Vivo X90 supports 4,810mAh battery with 120W wired fast charging. While the 4,870mAh battery of the Vivo X90 Pro is bigger and supports 120W fast charging.

articles.title: vivo brings its X90 series to India on April 26
articles.summary: The vivo X90 series is no mystery at this point as the company introduced its latest flagship iteration in several markets across the globe. Still, it's yet to make its debut on Indian soil.vivo now revealed April 26 as the launch date for India. The X90 Pro+ is unlikely to be part of it, so we expect the other two members there - the X90 Pro and the vanilla X90. It's what Europe got, anyway.Be the first to experience the Xtreme.Mark your calendars as the #vivoX90Series launches on 26th April 2023 at 12 PM.​​Stay tuned for more!​Know more: https:t.coW8bj8Lfpit​#XtremeImagination #ComingSoon pic.twitter.comUf7mUKq7E8 — vivo India (@Vivo_India) April 17, 2023The launch event itself is scheduled for April 26 at 12:00 PM local time. In the meantime, we suggest reading our full review of the X90 Pro to know if the phone is worth waiting for.

news.title: Google may launch Google Pixel Fold along with Google Pixel 7a on May 10: What we know

articles.title: Google may launch Google Pixel Fold along with Google Pixel 7a on May 10: What we know
articles.summary: Google Pixel Fold Announcement: May 10Pre-order from Google Store: May 10Pre-order from partners  carriers: Ma… https:t.coENCH0grdCQ — jon prosser (@jon_prosser) 1681750878000After Samsung launched the fold and flip smartphones in the global market, it opened the gates for the foldable devices to make a comeback, with better tech and modifications.While Apple is reportedly working on introducing a foldable device in the market soon, rumours have been riff regarding Google's Pixel Fold, the search engine giant's very own smartphone that bends, folds or maybe even flips.According to a new report, Google is gearing up to launch its Pixel Fold smartphone at the earliest. Yes, according to Jon Prosser, Google will be unveiling its brand new foldable phone, Google Pixel Fold on May 10.The tech company will reportedly launch the smartphone in the global market on June 27, with the pre-booking opening from May 10 itself, the report added.It is also being reported that Google will be launching the Pixel 7a alongside the Pixel Fold. Prosser's claim was further backed by tech tipster Snoopy Tech who has reported that the pocket-friendly smartphone will arrive in the market in next 14 days.The budget-friendly smartphone, Google Pixel 7a , will come in four colour options: Charcoal, Snow, Sea (Light Blue) and Coral. The report further suggests that Google will not discontinue the Pixel 6a phone.Now talking about the pricing, the Google Pixel Fold will most likely be priced at $1,799, whereas the Google Pixel 7a may be available at a starting price of $499.We can also expect Google to launch both the smartphones with Google's Tensor G2 processor. So far we don't know the configurations of RAM, internal storage space and the pixels on the Google Pixel Fold and Google Pixel 7a.Meanwhile, several reports suggest that the upcoming Google Pixel 7a will flaunt the same display size as the Google Pixel 6a. The smartphone may offer a faster fingerprint scanner and refresh rate of 90Hz.

articles.title: Google Pixel Fold and Pixel 7a prices and release dates leak
articles.summary: Google's first ever foldable and its next mid-range smartphone are both due to be unveiled together at the company's annual developer conference, new leaks reveal. On May 10, at Google IO, we will allegedly see the official introduction for both the Pixel Fold and the Pixel 7a.While they might be announced together, they won't be released at the same time. The Pixel 7a will be available immediately, for $499, in four colorways named Charcoal, Snow, Sea, and Coral - that last one being exclusive to the Google Store.Google Pixel 7a leaked renderThat's a $50 increase compared to the Pixel 6a, which, interestingly, will remain on sale even after its successor hits the streets. Presumably this means it might see a slight price drop too starting on May 10, but that's just speculation at this point.The Pixel 7a has been rumored to arrive with a new 64 MP main camera alongside a 13 MP ultrawide, the Tensor G2 SoC, a screen with 90 Hz refresh rate, and support for wireless chargingGoogle Pixel Fold leaked renderAt the other end of Google's price scale, the Pixel Fold is said to cost $1,799. Pre-orders will start on May 10 on the Google Store, and May 30 from carriers. It will only become available on June 27, though.Source 1 | Source 2 | Source 3

articles.title: Source: Pixel 7a to start at $499, available in stores May 11
articles.summary: Google’s Pixel 7a is just a few weeks away, rumored to launch at Google IO 2023 on May 10. This phone is set to be the successor to Google’s Pixel 6a, arguably the best-value phone of 2022. Thanks to a retail source, we now have the price for Pixel 7a.9to5Google can confirm that the price of Pixel 7a will be $499, a $50 increase over last year’s model.Given Google’s history of providing incredible value products in the Pixel A-series, the $50 increase does seem to come at an interesting time, somewhat unfortunate time. As the economy is being more turbulent and phone prices seem to be on the rise, it would have been expected for Google to keep the same price as in previous years. So why the jump?This increase likely comes from the new design and improvements. Google is upgrading the main camera to a 64MP main sensor flanked by a 13MP ultrawide shooter. This is outside of the Tensor G2 SoC found in the Pixel 7 and 7 Pro, the new 90hz display, and the long-awaited addition of wireless charging. These improvements are likely coming at a cost, which, unfortunately, is resulting in a higher price to consumers.Luckily, Google isn’t getting rid of all low-price options. Google will be keeping the Pixel 6a on deck at a decreased price. While we don’t have any more information on the price drop or around this, we have confirmed it will happen.With the Pixel 7a just a few weeks out, we will likely get more details soon. Earlier today, Jon Prosser said that the Pixel 7a will be available for purchase on May 10, right after Google IO. While this is true, you will not be able to get it in-store or delivered until May 11, the street date for the device. Prosser also noted that the phone will be sold in a “Coral” color option solely on the Google Store, in addition to previously-leaked colors.More on Pixel 7a:

articles.title: Pixel: Google has started shipping Pixel 7a to retailers: Report
articles.summary: Pixel 7a: Expected specs and designGoogle has already announced the dates of its annual developer conference, IO 2023 which is set to begin on May 10. At this event, the tech giant is expected to make announcements about multiple hardware and software products. Google may debut the Pixel 7a series, Google Pixel Fold , Android 14 and more at this event.A post shared by a Twitter user named SnoopyTech claims that the company is already started preparing itself before the launch of the Pixel 7a smartphone. Google has reportedly started shipping out the Pixel 7a models to retailers. The report also mentions that these devices are expected to be shipped within the next couple of weeks. Rumours suggest that the smartphone will be priced under Rs 40,000 in India.Google Pixel 7a will join the Pixel 7 and the Pixel 7 Pro smartphones in the lineup. The smartphone is expected to sport a 6.1-inch Full HD+ OLED display that may support a 90Hz of refresh rate.According to a report by GizmoChina, the upcoming Pixel 7a will also retain a sleek design and the signature Pixel metallic visor-like rear camera module.Pixel 7a’s leaked real-life images and design renders have also been making rounds of the internet. The smartphone is likely to come powered by Google’s custom-designed Tensor G2 chipset which might be backed by 8GB LPDDR5 RAM.For optics, the Pixel 7a is expected to house a dual rear camera setup which may include a 64MP Sony IMX787 main sensor and a 12MP ultra-wide angle lens. The smartphone may also feature a 10.8MP front shooter for selfies and video calls.The battery details of the Pixel 7a are still unknown, however, rumours suggest that the smartphone may support 5W wireless charging. Pixel 7a may run on Android 13 out of the box.

All four models feature 5G connectivity, upgraded cameras, and improved displays. The iPhone 14 Pro and Pro Max feature Apple's new A14 chip and a 120 Hz ProMotion display, while the iPhone 14 and mini feature the A13 chip and a standard 60Hz display. Other features include an improved Face ID, an in-display fingerprint sensor, and an upgraded dual-lens camera.The iPhone 14 is one of the latest and greatest smartphones in the Apple lineup. It features an advanced 15.40 cm (6.1-inch) Super Retina XDR display for an immersive experience in watching movies or playing games. The advanced camera system ensures better photos in any light condition, while the cinematic mode allows users to shoot videos in 4K Dolby Vision with up to 30 frames per second. In addition to essential safety features like crash detection that ask for assistance when you are unable to, action mode allows for steady, fluid, handheld video recording. The iPhone 14 is the perfect device for anyone looking for an all-in-one, powerful, and secure smartphone.- Midnight, Blue, Purple, Starlight, Yellow, RedThe iPhone 14 Plus is one of the latest mobiles in Apple's lineup, packed with features to make your life easier. The 6.7-inch Super Retina XDR display is perfect for streaming movies, playing games, and browsing the web. The advanced camera system takes stunning photos in any light, and now you can record in 4K Dolby Vision up to 30 fps. With Action mode, you can capture smooth, steady, handheld videos. And, with vital safety technology, it comes with a Crash Detection feature that will call for help when you can't. This makes the iPhone 14 Plus the perfect device for you to stay connected and protected.- Midnight, Blue, Purple, Starlight, Yellow, RedThe new iPhone 14 Pro is set to revolutionize the way you interact with your device. The 15.54 cm (6.1-inch) Super Retina XDR display features Always-On and ProMotion technology for an immersive experience, and the Dynamic Island allows you to use the iPhone in an exciting new way. With a 48MP main camera, you can take stunning photos with up to 4x greater resolution than before. Plus, the cinematic mode now supports 4K Dolby Vision up to 30 fps for a truly cinematic experience, and the action mode ensures that your videos are smooth and steady even when shooting handheld. This is the perfect device for capturing all of life's special moments.- Space black, Deep purple, Gold, SilverThe new iPhone 14 Pro Max is here, and it's the most powerful iPhone ever. The 6.7-inch Super Retina XDR display is beautiful and always-on, so you can always keep up with what's happening in your world. Dynamic Island is a revolutionary way to interact with your phone, and the 48MP main camera lets you capture amazing detail. This is the ultimate phone for power users, and it's sure to impress.- Space black, Deep purple, Gold, SilverDeals like these don't come around very often. So get ready to go shopping right away. news.title: Make These 3 Lifestyle Changes To Manage PCOS Symptoms Effectively

articles.title: Make These 3 Lifestyle Changes To Manage PCOS Symptoms Effectively
articles.summary: PCOS leads to irregular periodsPCOS is a condition that affects women in their reproductive age. In this condition, women experience irregular periods, hair fall, infertility, weight gain, mood swings and much more. The exact cause of PCOS is still unknown. If left uncontrolled, it can also lead to long-term complications such as Type-2 diabetes and an increased risk of heart disease. Along with medication, lifestyle changes play a major role in controlling PCOS and the complications associated with it. Weight loss, a healthy well-balanced diet and stress management are some of the ways to control PCOS symptoms.In one of her latest posts, nutritionist Lovneet Batra shares 3 simple tips that can help women with PCOS in more ways than one. Let's take a look at these.3 lifestyle changes to manage PCOS:1. Go for a walkIncreasing your overall physical activity helps women with PCOS in several ways. It helps in weight loss and controls the risk of developing complications associated with PCOS. The nutritionist recommends going for a walk for at least 30-45 minutes per day.2. Get some sunlightAccording to Batra, a good dose of natural light in the morning is good for those with PCOS.Sunlight helps boost the levels of vitamin D in the body. Your body produces vitamin D when exposed to sunlight. Studies have highlighted the role of vitamin D in PCOD management. Sufficient intake of vitamin D helps improve fertility, puts an individual in a better mood and reduces the risk of developing further diseases.3. Fix your sleep cycleInsufficient sleep can disturb your hormones and make you gain weight. Managing body weight is crucial for PCOS control. A healthy sleep cycle helps improve several symptoms and insulin resistance.Other than these you should also focus on weight management to control PCOS symptoms.Disclaimer: This content including advice provides generic information only. It is in no way a substitute for a qualified medical opinion. Always consult a specialist or your own doctor for more information. NDTV does not claim responsibility for this information.

articles.title: Why Women With PCOS Must Incorporate Physical Activity Into Their Lifestyle
articles.summary: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS), a hormonal disorder, affects many women worldwide. PCOS leads to weight gain, acne, and irregular periods. While PCOS is a lifelong condition, its symptoms can be managed through various treatments, including medication, lifestyle changes, and regular exercise. Regular exercise has been shown to have numerous benefits for women suffering from PCOS. Here’s a look at the importance of exercise in managing PCOS symptoms and the different types of exercise that can be beneficial for women with PCOS.Improves insulin sensitivityWomen with PCOS are often insulin-resistant, meaning their bodies don’t respond well to insulin, leading to high blood sugar levels. Insulin resistance is a significant contributing factor to the development of type 2 diabetes. Regular exercise, especially cardio, can improve insulin sensitivity, helping to prevent the onset of diabetes. Aids weight lossWeight gain is a common symptom of PCOS, and excess weight can exacerbate other symptoms such as irregular periods and acne. An exercise is a vital tool for weight loss, and regular physical activity can help women with PCOS to maintain a healthy weight. Losing even a small amount of weight can have significant benefits for PCOS management, such as improving insulin sensitivity and reducing the risk of other health conditions. Reduces the risk of diabetesType 2 diabetes is more likely to affect women with PCOS. Exercise can help to reduce this risk by improving insulin sensitivity and promoting weight loss. Improves cardiovascular healthWomen with PCOS are also at an increased risk of developing heart disease. Regular exercise can lower this risk by strengthening the cardiovascular system. Exercise strengthens the heart and reduces the risk of high blood pressure and other heart-related conditions. Cardiovascular health can be significantly impacted by even light exercise, like walking. Helps manage stress and mood disordersPCOS can cause mood disorders such as depression and anxiety, which can be debilitating for some women. Regular exercise is an effective way to manage stress and improve mood. Exercise stimulates the release of endorphins, which are natural mood boosters, and can help women with PCOS feel more relaxed and less anxious.Different types of exerciseWomen with PCOS can benefit from a variety of different types of exercise. Here are some examples:Cardiovascular Exercise: Cardiovascular or aerobic exercise is any exercise that increases your heart rate and breathing rate. Cardiovascular exercise is particularly effective for improving insulin sensitivity, reducing blood sugar levels, and promoting weight loss. Strength Training: Strength training involves working your muscles against resistance, such as lifting weights or using resistance bands. Strength training helps to build muscle mass, which in turn increases your metabolism and burns more calories. It can also help to improve insulin sensitivity and reduce the risk of diabetes. High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT): HIIT incorporates short bursts of high-intensity exercise interspersed with rest intervals or lower-intensity exercise. HIIT is particularly effective for promoting weight loss and improving insulin sensitivity. However, it may not be suitable for everyone, especially those with joint problems or who are new to exercise. Yoga: Yoga is a form of exercise that focuses on breathing, stretching, and relaxation. It can help to reduce stress levels, which is important for managing PCOS symptoms. Certain yoga poses, such as the reclining bound angle pose, can also help to stimulate the ovaries and regulate menstrual cycles. Pilates: Pilates is a form of exercise that focuses on core strength, posture, and balance. It involves a series of controlled movements that engage the muscles of the abdomen, hips, and back. Pilates can help to improve posture, reduce back pain, and promote weight loss.It’s important to pay attention to your body’s signals and refrain from overexerting yourself. Whenever you feel pain or discomfort while exercising, stop and take a break.Read all the Latest Lifestyle News here

articles.title: The hidden struggle: PCOS and mental health
articles.summary: PCOS and mental health are two topics that are increasingly coming into focus, as researchers and medical professionals recognize the significant impact PCOS can have on a woman's mental well-being. Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) is a hormonal disorder that affects up to 10% of women of reproductive age.It can cause a range of physical symptoms, from irregular periods and acne to weight gain and infertility. However, what's less known is the fact that PCOS can also have a profound effect on mental health, causing issues like anxiety, depression and body dysmorphia.The link between PCOS and mental health is complex and multifaceted. Women with PCOS are at a higher risk of developing mental health issues than those without the condition. For example, studies have shown that women with PCOS are more likely to experience symptoms of anxiety and depression.PCOS and mental health: Understanding the link and finding support (Image via Pexels)That's apparently due in part to the hormonal imbalances that accompany PCOS, and physical symptoms that can impact self-esteem and body image. Additionally, women with PCOS are more likely to develop eating disorders and body dysmorphia, as they struggle with weight gain and changes to their physical appearance.All these factors can lead to feelings of low self-worth, isolation and a reduced quality of life. As such, it's essential that women with PCOS receive adequate support and treatment to address their mental health needs.In this article, we explore the link between PCOS and mental health, discuss the ways in which PCOS can impact mental well-being and look at what can be done to manage and treat these issues.Link between PCOS and mental healthThe mind-body connection: PCOS and mental health (Image via Pexels)1) PCOS and anxietyAnxiety is a common mental health issue for women with PCOS, and it can be caused by a variety of factors. For example, hormonal imbalances can contribute to anxiety symptoms, as can the physical symptoms of PCOS, like weight gain, acne and excess hair growth.Additionally, the impact that PCOS can have on fertility and self-esteem can be a significant source of anxiety for many women. To manage anxiety related to PCOS, women may benefit from therapy, which can help them develop coping strategies and build resilience.Medications like antidepressants and anti-anxiety drugs may also be helpful, depending on the severity of symptoms. It's important for women with PCOS and anxiety to seek support and treatment, as untreated anxiety can lead to other issues, like depression and social isolation.2) PCOS and depressionDepression is another common mental health issue for women with PCOS and can be caused by many of the same factors that contribute to anxiety.For example, hormonal imbalances can affect mood, and the physical symptoms of PCOS can impact self-esteem and overall well-being. Depression can also be linked to the challenges of managing PCOS, like following a strict diet and exercise regimen.To manage depression related to PCOS, women may benefit from therapy, medication, or a combination of the two. It's important for women to seek treatment for depression, as untreated depression can lead to other issues, like social isolation, reduced quality of life and even suicidal ideation.3) PCOS and body dysmorphiaFinding support: Coping with PCOS (Image via Pexels)Body dysmorphia is a condition in which a person has a distorted view of their body, often fixating on perceived flaws or imperfections.Women with PCOS are at a higher risk of developing body dysmorphia, as the physical symptoms of PCOS can impact self-esteem and body image. For example, weight gain and excess hair growth can be particularly challenging for many women with PCOS.To manage body dysmorphia related to PCOS, women may benefit from therapy, which can help them develop a more positive body image and learn to cope with negative thoughts and feelings. Additionally, women may benefit from support groups or online communities, which can provide a sense of belonging and help them feel less isolated in their experiences.4) PCOS and eating disordersEating disorders are another common issue for women with PCOS, particularly those who struggle with weight gain and body image issues. Eating disorders can take many forms, from binge eating to restrictive eating, and can have serious consequences for physical and mental health.To manage eating disorders related to PCOS, women may benefit from therapy, which can help them develop a healthier relationship with food and body image. Additionally, women may benefit from working with a registered dietician, who can provide personalized guidance on nutrition and meal planning.It's important for women with PCOS and eating disorders to seek treatment, as these conditions can have long-term health consequences if left untreated.5) PCOS and insomniaPCOS and mental health (Image via Pexels)Insomnia, or difficulty sleeping, is a common issue for women with PCOS, and it can have a significant impact on mental health.Hormonal imbalances and physical symptoms of PCOS, like pain and discomfort, can make it difficult to fall asleep or stay asleep. Additionally, the stress and anxiety related to managing PCOS can contribute to insomnia.To manage insomnia related to PCOS, women may benefit from practicing good sleep hygiene, like avoiding caffeine and electronics before bedtime and establishing a regular sleep routine.Additionally, relaxation techniques, like meditation and deep breathing exercises, can be helpful in promoting relaxation and sleep. If insomnia persists, women may benefit from medication or cognitive behavioral therapy. That can help them develop healthy sleep habits and manage any underlying anxiety or stress.6) PCOS and self-careSelf-care is an important aspect of managing PCOS and promoting mental health. Women with PCOS may struggle with feelings of guilt or shame related to their condition, and taking time for self-care can help counteract these negative feelings. Self-care can take many forms, from exercise and healthy eating to engaging in hobbies and spending time with loved ones.It's important for women with this syndrome to understand the PCOS and mental health connection, and to prioritize self-care and make time for activities that promote their physical and mental well-being. Additionally, seeking support from loved ones and mental health professionals can be an important part of self-care for women with PCOS.PCOS and mental health (Image via Pexels)It's important to recognize that PCOS and mental health are interrelated. Women with PCOS may experience a range of mental health issues, from anxiety and depression to body dysmorphia and eating disorders. It's crucial for women with PCOS to prioritize their mental health and seek support and treatment as needed. This may include therapy, medication, lifestyle changes and self-care practices.By addressing the connection between PCOS and mental health, healthcare providers can better support women with this condition. Improved education and awareness can help women with PCOS feel more empowered to seek support for their mental health needs.It's important to recognize that mental health is a crucial component of overall health and well-being. Women with PCOS deserve access to high-quality care that addresses both their physical and mental health needs.Poll : 0 votes

articles.title: Why regular exercise is crucial for managing PCOS symptoms
articles.summary: PCOS has become dangerously common, and it can be challenging to manage. Research has shown that exercising regularly and managing your diet are key ways to help cope with stubborn PCOS symptoms.Anavi Someshwar, a fitness expert, and founder of ‘Hack Your Hormones,’ a program designed to sync with a woman’s menstrual phases, recommended a workout routine for people with PCOS.“Exercising can be difficult for women with PCOS because of insulin resistance. The body’s ability to use energy and effectively burn calories reduces. However, despite that, it’s incredibly integral for women with PCOS to participate in some sort of strength or resistance training activities at least thrice a week for 40 mins. It’s also a good idea to mix this up with cardio. Pilates works phenomenally too,” she explained.“Mind-body exercise like yoga is essential as well. Managing stress levels is a good goal to have since stress worsens PCOS. Strength training using weights or your own body weight can combat insulin resistance,” the expert added.According to The National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases, a lack of physical activity and excess body weight has been linked to insulin resistance. However, a literature review of studies published in the journal called Sports Medicine states that one specific exercise type has not been found to be the most helpful to women with PCOS.For women with PCOS, Healthline recommends HIIT workouts (high-intensity interval training), which involve having intense exercise bursts such as burpees, tuck jumps, and mountain climbers, along with a few rest intervals to balance it out.Just as the expert recommends, strength training can be incredibly helpful too. This type of exercise involves using resistance bands, weights, or your own body weight to build muscle.AdvertisementSomeshwar urged people to find out what works for them. “There are as many options. If you don’t want to go to the gym, you can do workouts from Youtube at home. You can even dance if you enjoy that — that counts as cardio. If you get bored of exercising easily, use a combination of different types of exercise methods. There’s always a way,” she explained.📣 For more lifestyle news, follow us on Instagram | Twitter | Facebook and don’t miss out on the latest updates!

articles.title: World Liver Day 2023: Signs of fatty liver on your face, eyes and skin
articles.summary: World Liver Day is celebrated on April 19 every year to spread awareness about the importance of liver health and educate people on how to maintain a healthy liver. Liver diseases are known to develop silently with no visible symptoms until the disease has advanced. Diseases like Hepatitis A, Hepatitis B, liver cirrhosis, liver cancer, non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) are now affecting people more than ever before. According to an estimate by WHO, between 1990 to 2017, there has been a 100% increase in the incidence of new liver cancer cases, two-thirds of which are attributable to viral hepatitis, and 16% due to unknown causes, including NAFLD. (Also read: Fatty liver: 3 easy exercises, 6 lifestyle changes to reverse liver disease) While fatty liver disease is often asymptomatic, some signs can indicate the presence of the disease(Freepik)Liver is a crucial organ that performs numerous essential functions in the body, including detoxification of harmful substances, production of bile to aid in digestion, and regulation of metabolism. Hence, taking care of this organ is crucial to prevent liver-related diseases. Preventing or managing metabolic disorders like obesity, diabetes and high cholesterol well could prevent NAFLD risk.One of the most common liver diseases is fatty liver disease, which affects millions of people around the world. Fatty liver disease occurs when there is an accumulation of fat in the liver, which can cause inflammation and damage to the liver tissue in advance stages. While fatty liver disease is often asymptomatic, some signs can indicate the presence of the disease, says Dr Amit Miglani - Director & HOD – Gastroenterology, Asian Hospital Faridabad.Non-alcoholic associated fatty liver disease is now a modern day non-communicable pandemic akin to Covid-19 and a major lifestyle disorder of modern age, major risk factors being sedentary lifestyle and faulty dietary practices. Unfortunately, not many symptoms or signs are seen on face, skin or eyes in the initial stages of the disease and by the time signs appear it would have already turned into advanced liver disease, says Dr Vinit Shah, Consultant Liver Transplant Physician & Hepatologist at Ruby Hall clinic.Very often you won't get any features of fatty liver on your face, eyes or skin. But we can get certain hints in some of the people. If somebody has darkening of the skin on the neck, which typically what is called as a nape of the neck, that indicates insulin resistance, and that would almost always be associated with fatty liver. Similarly, if there's darkening of the skins, in your armpits, or in the groins, those are also indications that the person may have a fatty liver, says Dr Akash Shukla, Director & Consultant, Department of Hepatology, Sir HN Reliance Foundation Hospital, Mumbai.Additionally, excessive chubbiness on the face or other parts of the body indicates that the person is likely to have fatty liver. If you get what we call as xanthelasma and xanthomas, which are whitish streaks, which are present very often around the eyes, face and some of the parts of the skin- those indicate high cholesterol, high triglyceride and would almost always be associated with fatty liver. So, if someone has these tell-tale signs, then they must investigate for sugar, cholesterol, heart disease, and fatty liver, adds Dr Shukla.He, however, cautions that absence of any of these does not mean absence of fatty liver disease. And therefore, anybody who has any risk factor for fatty liver like high cholesterol, high sugar, sedentary lifestyle, obesity, or a family history of fatty liver disease or consuming significant alcohol then they should investigate for presence of fatty liver.Dr Miglani shares signs of fatty liver on skin, eyes and faceJaundiceA medical condition known as jaundice causes the skin and eye whites to turn yellow. This happens when the liver is unable to get rid of bilirubin from the blood. When old red blood cells are broken down, bilirubin is created as a waste product. The liver breaks down bilirubin in healthy people and excretes it in the bile. Jaundice, on the other hand, develops when the liver is damaged and unable to handle bilirubin.Spider AngiomasSpider angiomas are small, red spider-like blood vessels that can appear on the face and neck. These are caused by an increase in oestrogen levels, which is common in people with liver disease. The liver is responsible for metabolising hormones, and when it is damaged, it can increase oestrogen levels.Palmar erythemaPalmar erythema is a condition where the palms of the hands turn red. This can be a sign of liver disease, as it is caused by an increase in blood flow to the palms. The exact mechanism behind this is not fully understood, but it is believed to be related to the build-up of toxins in the liver.Dark circles under the eyesDark circles under the eyes can be a sign of liver disease, as they are often caused by poor liver function. The liver is responsible for filtering toxins from the blood, and when it is unable to do so, it can result in a build-up of toxins in the body. This can lead to dark circles under the eyes and other symptoms such as fatigue and weakness.Acne and other skin conditionsAcne and other skin conditions can be a sign of liver disease, as the liver is responsible for removing toxins from the body. When the liver cannot do so, it can result in a build-up of toxins in the body, leading to skin problems such as acne.This liver disease is considered as a silent disease. It's a great setback because patient does not develop any symptoms and the disease advances gradually. Some people may experience pain or pressure in the middle or right side of their belly, fatigue, weakness, weight loss, loss of appetite and nausea. People with advanced liver disease may show symptoms like spider-like blood vessels, yellowing of the skin and eyes (jaundice), itching, fluid accumulation and swelling of the legs (edema), abdomen (ascites) and mental confusion. As there are no symptoms, patients need liver function test (blood test), and ultrasound for diagnosis. Fatty liver can be graded in a better way by Fibroscan, says Dr Punit Singla, Director & HOD - Liver Transplant & HPB Surgery, Marengo Asia Hospitals FaridabadFollow more stories on Facebook & Twitter

articles.title: Webinar on liver health and transplant organised
articles.summary: April 18, 2023 10:08 pm | Updated 10:29 pm IST - CHENNAIA webinar on liver health and transplant was organised on Tuesday as part of The Hindu Wellness Series on account of World Liver Day observed on April 19. It was conducted jointly by the Kauvery Hospitals and The Hindu.S. Velmurugan, head of the department of surgical gastroenterology and Swaminathan Sambandam, senior consultant and lead, multi-organ transplant from Kauvery Group of Hospitals spoke of the importance of the liver health and shared information regarding liver diseases, according to a press release.The doctor said, excessive consumption of carbohydrates and substance abuse could turn out to be significant risk factors and reiterated the need for a healthy lifestyle.“People think that eating too much fat causes fatty liver. Actually, it is carbohydrates that cause fatty liver. We need to include high fibre vegetables, fruits and millets in our diet regularly and exercise for at least 30 minutes a day,” Dr. Velmurugan said.The doctor spoke of the role of Transplantation Authority of Tamil Nadu, the governmental body coordinating all organ transplantation and said the State has now risen to be a leader in transplantation healthcare, the release said.“We are the pioneers in organ donation in the country and many states have learnt from us as well,” Dr. Swaminathan said.

articles.title: Liver diseases, screening is the key
articles.summary: In India, nearly 2 lakh die of liver disease every year while 10 lakh people are getting diagnosed with liver cirrhosis.The largest internal organ in the human body, liver is not just a digestive organ; it plays a major role in various metabolic processes, complex manufacturing of proteins, hormones, and excretory function.There has been an increase in the prevalence of liver diseases in the last two decades. In India, nearly 2 lakh die of liver disease every year while 10 lakh people are getting diagnosed with liver cirrhosis.Among the population in Kerala, the prevalence of liver diseases is higher with at least 300 patients undergoing expensive treatments like liver transplantation.In the last couple of decades, the rate of metabolic disorders such as hypercholesterolemia, diabetes and hypertension has been increasing. The major reasons are sedentary lifestyle and changes in eating habits. Over eating and alcohol consumption have adversely impacted the liver and digestive health of the people.Why liver diseases are known as silent killers?Whatever be the cause of liver disease, whether alcohol or Nonalcoholic Fatty liver disease (NAFLD), viruses or genetic reasons, the progression happens in a particular manner. Initially fat accumulates (steatosis), followed by inflammation of liver cells (hepatitis) and finally scarring of tissues (fibrosis). Advanced fibrosis results in cirrhosis.The different stages of the progression of the disease, which will occur in 20 to 30 years, to reach the stage of cirrhosis is silent. Usually, the patient doesn’t have any symptoms even when significant changes are happening to the tissues in the liver. The symptoms will surface only when the conditions worsens to the final stage. The silent phase is the golden window of opportunity to treat and recover fully before permanent damage happens in the forms of cirrhosis or liver cancer.The silent phase of liver diseases is the time to get treated and cured. During the symptomatic phase of the disease permanent damage will happen to the liver. The good news is that the liver can completely reverse the condition and regain normal health through timey intervention and treatment. The real challenge is to diagnose the disease at its silent phase. This is where screening is crucial.Screening for liver diseases: When and how?Two decades ago, the average age of patients with chronic liver disease and cirrhosis was 50 or 60. Now, patients in their 40s undergoing liver transplant is not that uncommon. Liver disease screening, after the age of 40 would be an ideal goal, especially for those with risk factors such as regular alcohol consumption, over weight obesity, diabetes, high cholesterol, hypertension and those with family history of chronic liver disease.Most patients go by a combination of the blood test – LFT and liver ultrasonogram (USG). But this test fails to detect pre-cirrhosis in its silent phase.1. Fibroscan- This is a painless scanning. Fibroscan gives semi-quantitative assessment of scarring fibrosis (which is pre-runner of cirrhosis) as well as quantification of fat in the liver. This assesses liver stiffness by passing ultrasonic waves into liver substance. Fibroscan assesses pre-cirrhosis in its silent phase.2. Ultrasonogram: This gives a rough estimate of fat in the liver. It can detect cirrhosis when it is full-fledged. But silent pre-cirrhosis is rarely detected; hence Ultrasonogram is not an ideal stand-alone screening technique.3. Blood tests: LFT and Platelet count. With progression of scarring fibrosis in the liver, platelet count dips over the years. This is a simple technique of assessing silent cirrhosis. The formulae based on platelet count, viz, APRI, FIB 4 are also used to assess pre-cirrhosis and liver scarring.Economic perspective of liver disease screeningChronic Liver disease, after it reaches the stage of cirrhosis or liver cancer translates into high health care expenditure. Liver transplant and treatment modalities of cancer are quite expensive. If chronic liver disease is detected at its silent phase through screening, restoring normalcy is possible. The expense for screening and the treatment is quite less, mostly involving lifestyle modifications, treatment of liver directed viruses or rarely treatment of genetic disease which causes iron copper over load.In summary, detection of the silent phase of liver diseases through screening techniques not only averts permanent damage to the liver, but also helps reduce overall health care expenses.
